review_title: Decent place to start a career, not to stay
pros: Very friendly and relaxed place to work. They'll give you the opportunity to grow and take on new experiences. Your job at BC is pretty much what you make of it.
cons: The salary and benefits were the major problem. There is almost no room for salary increases and your pay is going to be well under the industry average. For some positions as much as 30-40% below your peers in the same position across other industries. This wasn't a problem until recently but higher education as a whole is struggling financially, and the private colleges more than the publics. Which is making job security a major issue as well. Benefits have been reduced and the health insurance offered is both sub par and extremely expensive for what you get.
